intro: Phacelia malvifolia subsp. loasifolia, commonly known as the desert phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and high sunlight exposure.
